title: Python Knowledge Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of Python fundamentals with this interactive quiz.

sections.title: Quiz Introduction
sections.content: This quiz will test your understanding of the Python concepts we've covered in the previous lessons. Complete all questions to demonstrate your knowledge. Each question you answer correctly will be marked with a checkmark in the sidebar.

sections.title: Question 1: Print Function
sections.content: What is the primary purpose of the print() function in Python?
options: To create a printed copy of your code
To display output to the console
To save data to a file

feedback.correct: Correct! The print() function is used to display output to the console.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. The print() function is used to display output to the console.

sections.title: Question 2: Function Definition
sections.content: Which of the following is the correct way to define a function in Python?

feedback.correct: Correct! In Python, functions are defined using the 'def' keyword followed by the function name and parentheses.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. In Python, functions are defined using the 'def' keyword followed by the function name and parentheses.

sections.title: Question 3: Temperature Conversion
sections.content: What is the result of calling celsius_to_fahrenheit(0)?

feedback.correct: Correct! When converting 0°C to Fahrenheit using the formula F = (C × 9/5) + 32, we get 32°F.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. When converting 0°C to Fahrenheit using the formula F = (C × 9/5) + 32, we get 32°F.

sections.title: Question 4: Lists in Python
sections.content: Which of the following correctly creates a list in Python?

feedback.correct: Correct! Lists in Python are created using square brackets [].
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Lists in Python are created using square brackets [].

sections.title: Question 5: Valid Python Data Structures
sections.content: Which of the following are built-in data structures in Python? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Correct! Lists, dictionaries, sets, and tuples are all built-in data structures in Python.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. The built-in data structures in Python are lists, dictionaries, sets, and tuples. Arrays are part of the NumPy library, and structs don't exist in Python natively.

sections.title: Question 6: Comments in Python
sections.content: Which of the following are valid ways to create comments in Python? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Correct! In Python, you can use the # symbol for single-line comments and triple quotes (''' or """) for multi-line comments or docstrings.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. In Python, comments are created using the # symbol for single-line comments and triple quotes (''' or """) for multi-line comments or docstrings.

sections.title: Quiz Conclusion
sections.content: Congratulations on completing the Python fundamentals quiz! Your results show how well you've grasped the core concepts we've covered so far. If you missed any questions, consider revisiting the related lessons to strengthen your understanding.
